mdRecord.dcterms:title: Fayerweather Hall, exterior|detail view
Fayerweather Gymnasium
mdRecord.dcterms:creator: Carpenter and Peebles (American architectural firm, 1890-1897) [architectural firm]
Dagit Saylor Architects (American architectural firm, from 1970) [architectural firm, renovation]
mdRecord.dcterms:publisher: Rector and Visitors of the University of Virginia
mdRecord.dcterms:description: Southwest corner of portico, showing moisture damage to brick, before renovation

The Universityâ€™s first purpose-built sports facility. One of a series of gymnasia that were funded by wealthy New York shoe manufacturer Daniel B. Fayerweather for campuses across the country. Memorial Gymnasium replaced it in 1924; Paul Goodloe McIntire provided the gift to fund the McIntire School of Fine Arts in 1919. Renovations took place 2004-2006. [work]
mdRecord.dcterms:isPartOf: James Murray Howard University of Virginia Historic Buildings and Grounds Collection
